item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode, we explored a massive data breach that may have compromised the personal information of around one-third of Americans. The cyberattack on UnitedHealth Group's subsidiary, Change Healthcare, exploited stolen credentials to bypass security measures and deploy ransomware, raising concerns about healthcare data vulnerabilities.
 
For more details, see: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Third-of-US-nFp0wg1gTGOHit5gZjJqNg

We also look into British singer-songwriter FKA twigs' testimony before the U.S. Senate on the potential benefits and risks of AI technology in the creative industries. While embracing AI as a tool under her control, twigs warned about the dangers of unchecked AI leading to unauthorized exploitation of artists' work and identities. She advocated for legislation like the NO FAKES Act to protect creators' rights.

For more information, visit: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/FKA-Twigs-submits-zVCkqToyRaW6GYjs0ZJKWw

Additionally, we explored Airbnb's new "Icons" category, featuring unique listings like a replica of the floating house from the Pixar film "Up." These promotional stays aim to generate buzz and keep Airbnb culturally relevant, catering to a niche market seeking extraordinary travel experiences.

For more details on the "Up" house and other iconic listings, see: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Airbnb-lists-the-CMhC.04iSfam5jjcil7z9g

We also discussed the rise of Power Slap, a controversial yet increasingly popular combat sport owned by UFC's Dana White, where competitors slap each other in the face. While garnering attention and a dedicated fan base, the sport has faced criticism over potential health risks and ethical concerns.

For more on Power Slap's origins, format, and controversies, visit: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/The-rise-of-lVMMtaT0TvC3PCxjYNOfsQ

Finally, we explored the "Purple Earth hypothesis," which suggests that alien life on other planets could be purple-pigmented microorganisms using retinal phototrophy, similar to early life on Earth. This idea expands the search for extraterrestrial life beyond the traditional "red edge" of chlorophyll.

For more information on this intriguing hypothesis, see: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Alien-life-may-uZVem4h8S8W3bP5uHjXMwA

item.itunes:title: Apple's Swiss AI, Binance Sentencing, UK Password Ban, Insect Minds & NASA Refueling
item.title: Apple's Swiss AI, Binance Sentencing, UK Password Ban, Insect Minds & NASA Refueling
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode, we find Apple has a secretive AI research facility in Zurich working on computer vision, machine learning, robotics, and autonomous systems. Its work is already used in products like FaceTime and aims to develop new visual AI capabilities for Siri to change how people interact with technology. Binance founder Changpeng Zhao received 4 months in prison and a $50M fine for failing to implement anti-money laundering measures...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode, we find Apple has a secretive AI research facility in Zurich working on computer vision, machine learning, robotics, and autonomous systems. Its work is already used in products like FaceTime and aims to develop new visual AI capabilities for Siri to change how people interact with technology.

Binance founder Changpeng Zhao received 4 months in prison and a $50M fine for failing to implement anti-money laundering measures, allowing criminal exploitation of the crypto exchange. Though prosecutors sought 3 years, Zhao retains equity despite stepping down as CEO.

The UK banned easily guessable default passwords on IoT devices through new cybersecurity laws. Manufacturers must provide unique passwords and disclose security details. Non-compliance risks fines up to £10M or 4% of global revenue.

Recent studies suggest insects may possess basic consciousness based on complex behaviors, brain structures similar to human midbrains, and ability to modify behavior based on environment. The ethical implications for animal welfare are significant.

NASA plans orbital refueling of SpaceX's Starship for lunar missions using new in-space propellant transfer tech. Key challenges include managing propellant dynamics in microgravity. Up to 20 refueling launches may be needed per mission.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:
Apple's Secretive Swiss AI Lab:
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Apples-secretive-Swiss-8jvTSq3oSr.82ATSgxPqqA

https://www.perplexity.ai/search/UK-bans-bad-75rhuNQ.RjG5vIeEbrmhng
Rethinking Insect Consciousness:

item.itunes:title: Tesla's FSD Approval in China, Nuclear Clock Progress, DJI's US Hurdles, Supercomputer Sale, Google Layoffs
item.title: Tesla's FSD Approval in China, Nuclear Clock Progress, DJI's US Hurdles, Supercomputer Sale, Google Layoffs
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore Tesla's significant milestone in securing approval for its Full Self-Driving (FSD) software in China. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore Tesla's significant milestone in securing approval for its Full Self-Driving (FSD) software in China. This development is expected to accelerate Tesla's growth in the world's largest auto market and intensify competition in the electric vehicle (EV) and autonomous driving sectors. We also discuss recent advancements in nuclear clock technology, with researchers making progress using scandium-45 and thorium-229, bringing the development of these highly precise timekeeping devices closer to reality.

The episode also covers the legislative challenges faced by DJI, a leading drone manufacturer, in the United States. The proposed "Countering CCP Drones Act" could effectively ban DJI from using U.S. communications infrastructure, potentially impacting various sectors that rely on DJI drones. We then delve into the auction of the Cheyenne supercomputer, which was once one of the world's most powerful and energy-efficient supercomputers. The sale of its parts highlights the rapid pace of technological advancement in supercomputing.

Finally, we discuss Google's recent layoff of its entire Python team as part of a broader cost-cutting strategy involving outsourcing jobs to cheaper labor markets. This move reflects the tech giant's efforts to streamline operations and optimize its workforce in response to economic pressures and shifting business priorities. The layoffs have deeply affected employees and are part of a series of layoffs across various departments within Google, aligning with the company's strategy to invest more heavily in areas like artificial intelligence.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:
Google lays off Python team
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Google-lays-off-ZBS6dB9mSzqqA7OGS0M1sA
Cheyenne supercomputer up for sale

DJI drones face US restrictions
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/DJI-drones-face-.gX6F6HMSA.PCaKFltO4Qg
Nuclear clock closer to reality

Tesla's full self-driving approval in China

We also discuss recent advancements in nuclear clock technology, with researchers making progress using scandium-45 and thorium-229, bringing the development of these highly precise timekeeping devices closer to reality.

We then delve into the auction of the Cheyenne supercomputer, which was once one of the world's most powerful and energy-efficient supercomputers. The sale of its parts highlights the rapid pace of technological advancement in supercomputing.

Finally, we discuss Google's recent layoff of its entire Python team as part of a broader cost-cutting strategy involving outsourcing jobs to cheaper labor markets. This move reflects the tech giant's efforts to streamline operations and optimize its workforce in response to economic pressures and shifting business priorities. The layoffs have deeply affected employees and are part of a series of layoffs across various departments within Google, aligning with the company's strategy to invest more heavily in areas like artificial intelligence.

item.title: Gen Z's Career Shift, AI Home Security, Lifespan Prediction, and the Dark Side of Voice Cloning
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode, we explore how Gen Z is reshaping the job market by increasingly opting for blue-collar careers, driven by economic factors and concerns about AI disrupting traditional office roles. We also delve into the controversial use of tear gas in AI home security systems like PaintCam, which raises ethical concerns about the use of such deterrents in residential settings. Next, we discuss Life2vec, an AI tool that estimates an ...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode, we explore how Gen Z is reshaping the job market by increasingly opting for blue-collar careers, driven by economic factors and concerns about AI disrupting traditional office roles. We also delve into the controversial use of tear gas in AI home security systems like PaintCam, which raises ethical concerns about the use of such deterrents in residential settings.

Next, we discuss Life2vec, an AI tool that estimates an individual's lifespan based on various health and demographic data, raising significant ethical and privacy concerns. Additionally, we examine a concerning incident of unauthorized AI voice cloning, where BBC presenter Liz Bonnin's likeness and voice were used without her consent in an advertising campaign, highlighting the need for regulatory measures to address the challenges posed by advanced AI technologies.

Finally, we look ahead to a historic event where Pope Francis will attend the upcoming G7 summit to discuss the challenges and implications of artificial intelligence, bringing a unique perspective on the moral and ethical dimensions of AI. His participation is expected to generate significant interest and add a new dimension to the critical discussions surrounding the development and governance of artificial intelligence.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

Gen Zers are choosing blue-collar jobs
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Gen-Zers-are-fUfl69epTV2guGv2RmKSuA

https://www.perplexity.ai/search/AI-home-security-YheDSh1wTRmuvuiHuc8rOA

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

Welcome to today's episode of Discover Daily, where we explore a range of stories that capture the essence of innovation, environmental shifts, and cosmic endeavors. We start with a look at Alphabet, Google's parent company, as it reaches an impressive $2 trillion market cap, marking its place as a tech industry titan.

The episode then transitions to discuss the anticipated end of the El Niño weather pattern and the potential implications of a forthcoming La Niña phase, which could significantly impact weather systems across the globe.We also share exciting news from NASA, where engineers have successfully reestablished communication with the Voyager 1 spacecraft, ensuring its continued journey through interstellar space.

To cap off the episode, we dive into the world of viral trends with the "sleepy girl mocktail," a TikTok sensation that promises to help listeners relax and improve their sleep. Each story is filled with insightful details that will engage your curiosity and expand your understanding of these diverse topics.

For additional information on these stories, you can follow the links provided below:

  • Google surpasses $2 trillion market cap: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Google-surpasses-2-FIv8EGmTS1W9nR2VJI8yQA
  • Instagram testing AI-bot creator: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Instagram-testing-AIbot-W285SMBeSLyIUX8_NUPTaQ
  • The end of El Niño: https://www.perplexity.ai/search/The-end-of-3KqlkwfXS6mkqBpLcD6NYw

item.itunes:title: xAI's Billions, Onion's New Chapter, and Quantum Internet Potential
item.title: xAI's Billions, Onion's New Chapter, and Quantum Internet Potential
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! Elon Musk's AI startup xAI is close to securing a massive $6 billion investment that values the company at $18 billion. This interconnected AI ecosystem could provide a competi...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

Elon Musk's AI startup xAI is close to securing a massive $6 billion investment that values the company at $18 billion. Key investors include Sequoia Capital, Future Ventures, Valor Equity Partners, and Gigafund. The funds will be used to further develop xAI's chatbot Grok, which aims to leverage data from Musk's companies like Tesla, SpaceX, and Neuralink to enhance its capabilities. This interconnected AI ecosystem could provide a competitive edge against rivals OpenAI and Anthropic as Musk seeks to create a networked system benefiting all his ventures.

The U.S. government has formed a new Artificial Intelligence Safety and Security Board under the Department of Homeland Security. This 22-member board includes tech CEOs from OpenAI, Microsoft, Google, Nvidia and representatives from major companies. Notably absent are social media giants Meta and Twitter. The board will advise on protecting critical infrastructure from potential AI disruptions and help stakeholders use AI responsibly, as emphasized by DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas. Its formation is part of the Biden administration's efforts to regulate AI.

In the digital media space, Jeff Lawson, co-founder of Twilio, has acquired the satirical news outlet The Onion through his company Global Tetrahedron. Plans include shifting to a subscription model, enhancing social media presence, and reviving projects like The Onion News Network. The acquisition aims to preserve The Onion's editorial voice while potentially increasing writer compensation. Separately, the AI-powered startup Curio has developed an AI news anchor called Rio that provides personalized audio news briefings from trusted sources like The Wall Street Journal through an interactive chatbot interface. Rio is currently in early access with plans for a public launch later this year.

From Perplexity's Discover feed

Musk's xAI fundraising nears $6 billion
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Musks-xAI-fundraising-SHKPouRdTaSpgOqRpDgm0g

Altman, Nadella join AI safety board

Designing a quantum internet

item.itunes:title: FCC Revives Net Neutrality, Fisker's Financial Woes, and Plato's Burial Site Revealed
item.title: FCC Revives Net Neutrality, Fisker's Financial Woes, and Plato's Burial Site Revealed
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In a significant development for internet regulation, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has officially restored net neutrality rules, reclassifying broadband internet as a utility-like service and prohibiting practices like throttling, blocking, or paid prioritization of online content. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In a significant development for internet regulation, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has officially restored net neutrality rules, reclassifying broadband internet as a utility-like service and prohibiting practices like throttling, blocking, or paid prioritization of online content. This decision has been met with praise from consumer advocacy groups but strong opposition from the telecommunications industry. Meanwhile, early reviews of the Rabbit R1, a novel AI-powered gadget, present a mixed but generally optimistic view of its potential to simplify tasks and reduce screen time through its ability to learn from user interactions. However, the device is still in its early stages, with some features not functioning as advertised.

On the automotive front, electric vehicle manufacturer Fisker Inc. is facing severe financial difficulties and may seek bankruptcy protection within the next 30 days due to a critical shortage of funds and inability to meet its debt obligations. The company has faced production issues with its Fisker Ocean SUV, workforce reductions, and a plummeting stock price. In the realm of archaeology, researchers have made a significant discovery regarding the burial site of ancient Greek philosopher Plato, utilizing advanced imaging and AI technologies to decipher carbonized papyrus scrolls from Herculaneum. The texts indicate that Plato was buried in a private garden at the Platonic Academy in Athens and shed light on a tumultuous period in his life.

Finally, the hunt for the hypothetical Planet 9 in the outer solar system continues, with recent research providing new evidence and insights. A study analyzing the orbits of Neptune-crossing objects shows their alignment with predictions of models that include Planet 9, while other analyses have narrowed down the search area. An indirect detection approach suggests looking for potential satellites of Planet 9, as tidal heating effects could make them detectable in the infrared. Astronomers will continue scanning the outer solar system in hopes of finally spotting this elusive giant planet.

From Perplexity’s Discover feed:

FCC restores net neutrality
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/FCC-restores-net-VYOex1fVQ6._hLusRXBWYQ

Rabbit R1 initial reviews
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Rabbit-R1-initial-uPgGhx_jTsWFnNFCxUI2yg

Fisker heads toward bankruptcy
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Fisker-heads-toward-t3I.JykXSWOqIeD0lt1Hyw

Papyrus reveals Pla

item.itunes:title: Biden's TikTok Tug-of-War, Apple's Privacy Play with OpenELM, and the Fiery Ethics of a Flamethrower Robo-Dog
item.title: Biden's TikTok Tug-of-War, Apple's Privacy Play with OpenELM, and the Fiery Ethics of a Flamethrower Robo-Dog
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we're navigating the intersection of technology and policy, starting with the potential ban of TikTok in the United States. President Joe Biden's recent legislative action could force TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to sell the app or face a ban, stirring up a storm of controversy and debate. We'll examine the paradox of the Biden campaign's use of TikTok for voter engagement amidst national securit...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we're navigating the intersection of technology and policy, starting with the potential ban of TikTok in the United States. President Joe Biden's recent legislative action could force TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to sell the app or face a ban, stirring up a storm of controversy and debate. We'll examine the paradox of the Biden campaign's use of TikTok for voter engagement amidst national security concerns and the company's vow to challenge the ban in court.

Next, we shift our focus to Apple's groundbreaking OpenELM project, which introduces a new family of open-source large language models designed to run locally on devices. This innovative approach promises to enhance privacy and processing speed, marking a significant shift from cloud-based AI. We'll discuss the features and capabilities of OpenELM, its integration with iOS 18, and what this means for the future of on-device AI technologies.

Finally, we'll delve into the fiery realm of robotics with the Thermonator, a flamethrower-equipped robotic dog developed by Throwflame. Built on the Unitree Go1 platform, the Thermonator raises ethical questions and concerns about the weaponization of robotic technologies. We'll also touch on Nvidia's strategic acquisition of the AI startup Run:ai and wrap up with the long-awaited introduction of a native Calculator app for the iPad in the upcoming iPadOS 18 release. Join us as we explore these fascinating developments that are shaping the tech landscape.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

Biden signs TikTok ban
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Biden-signs-TikTok-NNhysG12Qmull2GUiQV4qw
Apple releases on-device AI model
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Apple-releases-ondevice-zsskx2HvSiCebuNwOtbQLA
The Thermonator flame-throwing robodog
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/The-Thermonator-flamethrowing-fqpFxipFSb.Z3MAaTE5V8w

iPad finally gets a calculator

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode, we explore a range of fascinating developments at the intersection of AI, law enforcement, labor regulations, automotive privacy, and startup funding.

First, we take a look at Microsoft's new Phi-3 family of compact yet powerful language models that bring advanced AI capabilities to smartphones and edge devices. Next, we examine Axon's "Draft One" tool that uses AI to automatically generate police reports from body cam audio, aiming to reduce paperwork and increase community engagement time for officers. We also break down the FTC's groundbreaking decision to ban non-compete agreements nationwide, a move poised to boost worker mobility and entrepreneurship.

Shifting gears, we investigate troubling reports accusing GM of tracking drivers' behavior through its OnStar system and sharing that data with insurers without proper consent, underscoring the growing privacy concerns surrounding connected cars. Finally, we celebrate a milestone close to home as Perplexity AI, the company behind this podcast, achieves unicorn status with a $1 billion valuation thanks to the incredible support of listeners like you. It's an exciting time as Perplexity builds the future of search, and we're grateful to have you along for the ride.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

Microsoft debuts Phi-3 model

item.title: Amazon's Robot Army, Sodium-Ion Speedsters, and Dalí's AI Revival
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! Discover the latest innovations in technology and art with Perplexity's Discover Daily podcast. In this captivating episode, host Alex, powered by ElevenLabs AI, takes you on a journey through Amazon's growing army of 750,000 collaborative robots, groundbreaking advancements in fast-charging sodium-ion batteries, and the AI-powered "Ask Dalí" installation at the Dalí Museum in St. Petersburg, Florida. Uncover how Amazon's robots are revolut...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

Discover the latest innovations in technology and art with Perplexity's Discover Daily podcast. In this captivating episode, host Alex, powered by ElevenLabs AI, takes you on a journey through Amazon's growing army of 750,000 collaborative robots, groundbreaking advancements in fast-charging sodium-ion batteries, and the AI-powered "Ask Dalí" installation at the Dalí Museum in St. Petersburg, Florida. Uncover how Amazon's robots are revolutionizing efficiency and safety in the workplace, while also exploring the potential impact on human roles within the company.

Dive into the world of sustainable energy storage with recent breakthroughs in sodium-ion battery technology. Learn how researchers from Japan, China, and Sweden are developing batteries capable of charging in mere minutes or even seconds, using abundant and low-cost materials like sodium. Explore the implications of these advancements for the future of electric vehicles and the shift towards more eco-friendly energy solutions.

Step into the mind of Salvador Dalí, the iconic Surrealist artist, through the groundbreaking "Ask Dalí" installation. Discover how visitors can engage in unique, AI-generated conversations with a digital replica of Dalí, powered by OpenAI's GPT-4 and trained on the artist's archival audio and writings. Witness the intersection of art and technology as the Dalí Museum continues to push the boundaries of interactive exhibits, celebrating the innovative spirit that Dalí himself embodied. For more fascinating stories like these, download the Perplexity app on Android or iOS and stay curious with Discover Daily.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Amazon deployed over 750k robots
  • Sodium battery that charges in seconds
  • Dali lobster phone uses AI

In today's episode of Discover Daily, a podcast powered by Perplexity, we explore the growing influence of artificial intelligence across various industries. From the U.S. House of Representatives taking steps to ban the popular social media app TikTok due to national security concerns, to rapper Drake releasing an AI-generated diss track featuring the voices of Tupac Shakur and Snoop Dogg, AI is making waves and sparking important conversations. We also delve into the entertainment industry, where Creative Artists Agency (CAA) is exploring the use of AI to create digital doubles of artists, raising questions about the rights to these digital personas and the implications for actors' careers.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • US House moves to ban TikTok
  • Drake records song with AI Tupac
  • Talent agency CAA tests AI clones of artists

item.itunes:title: Tesla Cybertruck Recall, Bicycle Day, and Bitcoin Halving
item.title: Tesla Cybertruck Recall, Bicycle Day, and Bitcoin Halving
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we jump into a major recall affecting all Tesla Cybertruck vehicles due to a critical issue with the accelerator pedal. We explore the details of this recall, which impacts 3,878 vehicles, and discuss how a viral TikTok video played a pivotal role in bringing this safety concern to light. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we jump into a major recall affecting all Tesla Cybertruck vehicles due to a critical issue with the accelerator pedal. We explore the details of this recall, which impacts 3,878 vehicles, and discuss how a viral TikTok video played a pivotal role in bringing this safety concern to light. Learn about Tesla's response and the implications for Cybertruck owners and the automotive industry.

We also celebrate Bicycle Day, commemorating the first intentional LSD trip by Swiss chemist Albert Hofmann in 1943. Discover the fascinating history of LSD, from its accidental discovery to its profound impact on psychiatry, culture, and the counterculture movement. Join us as we discuss how this day is celebrated and its significance in the ongoing conversation about psychedelics and their therapeutic potential.

Rounding out the episode, we examine the upcoming Bitcoin halving event expected around April 19-20, 2024. Understand the mechanics behind Bitcoin halving, its effects on the cryptocurrency market, and what this means for miners and investors alike. Whether you're a crypto enthusiast or just curious about digital currencies, this segment offers valuable insights into the dynamics of Bitcoin's supply and its long-term economic implications.

From Perplexity's Discover feed

  • Tesla recalling all Cybertrucks
  • The history of Bicycle Day
  • Upcoming Bitcoin halving

item.itunes:title: Meta's Llama 3, Amazon's Covert Operation, and EU Scrutiny of Microsoft-OpenAI Deal
item.title: Meta's Llama 3, Amazon's Covert Operation, and EU Scrutiny of Microsoft-OpenAI Deal
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode of the Discover Daily podcast by Perplexity, we explore the latest advancements in AI technology, corporate espionage tactics, and potential antitrust investigations. First, we dive into Meta's release of Llama 3, a series of open-source large language models designed to enhance AI applications across various platforms. These powerful models, available in 8 billion and 70 billion parameter versions, are already integrated in...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of the Discover Daily podcast by Perplexity, we explore the latest advancements in AI technology, corporate espionage tactics, and potential antitrust investigations. First, we dive into Meta's release of Llama 3, a series of open-source large language models designed to enhance AI applications across various platforms. These powerful models, available in 8 billion and 70 billion parameter versions, are already integrated into major cloud platforms and will power Meta's new AI assistant.

Next, we uncover Amazon's covert "Big River" operation, a secret intelligence-gathering project aimed at collecting data on its competitors. By creating a subsidiary that posed as an independent entity, Amazon employees were able to attend rivals' conferences undercover and gather sensitive information on pricing, logistics, and business practices, raising questions about corporate espionage.

Finally, we examine the potential EU antitrust investigation into Microsoft's $13 billion investment in OpenAI. The European Commission is assessing whether this partnership could restrict competition within the EU market, focusing on whether Microsoft exerts control over OpenAI. While no formal probe has been launched yet, the situation remains fluid as other regulatory bodies also consider their own investigations.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Meta released Llama 3
  • Amazon's secret 'Big River' ops
  • EU antitrust case on Microsoft-OpenAI

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we uncover the latest advancements in humanoid robotics as Boston Dynamics unveils its sleeker, more agile all-electric Atlas robot, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the field. We also explore the skyrocketing valuation of Mistral AI, a Paris-based startup specializing in large language models, as it seeks new funding at a staggering $5 billion valuation, showcasing the rapid growth and potential of AI technology. Finally, we delve into the tense standoff between Google employees and the tech giant over Project Nimbus, a controversial $1.2 billion contract with the Israeli government, highlighting the growing concerns over the ethical implications of technology in our increasingly connected world.

item.itunes:title: Limitless AI Wearable, Hidden Microchip Art, and Microsoft's $1.5B UAE Investment
item.title: Limitless AI Wearable, Hidden Microchip Art, and Microsoft's $1.5B UAE Investment
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode of Discover Daily, the AI-powered podcast by Perplexity.ai, we explore three fascinating stories from the world of technology. First, we discuss the Limitless AI Pendant, a cutting-edge wearable device that's revolutionizing productivity and communication. With its compact design, impressive battery life, and privacy-focused features, the Limitless AI Pendant is gaining attention in the AI wearables market. Discover how this...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, the AI-powered podcast by Perplexity.ai, we explore three fascinating stories from the world of technology. First, we discuss the Limitless AI Pendant, a cutting-edge wearable device that's revolutionizing productivity and communication. With its compact design, impressive battery life, and privacy-focused features, the Limitless AI Pendant is gaining attention in the AI wearables market. Discover how this device is enhancing video calls, meetings, and personal note-taking, and learn why it's an improvement over its predecessor, the Humane AI Pin.

Next, we uncover the hidden art of microchip graffiti, a little-known practice that has been a part of the semiconductor industry for decades. Explore the origins and evolution of this unique form of microscopic artwork, from its practical purposes in the early days of chip design to its role as a creative outlet for engineers. Learn about the motivations behind creating chip art, the methods used to etch these tiny masterpieces, and the efforts to preserve this fascinating legacy. Discover how websites like the Silicon Zoo are cataloging and celebrating these miniature wonders, showcasing the whimsical and human side of technology.

Finally, we discuss Microsoft's $1.5 billion investment in G42, an artificial intelligence and cloud computing company based in Abu Dhabi. This expanded partnership aims to accelerate AI development and build out the UAE's sovereign cloud capabilities, with G42 leveraging Microsoft's Azure infrastructure to create AI solutions for various industries. Learn about the joint projects planned by Microsoft and G42, the expansion of Microsoft's data center presence in the UAE, and the company's efforts to address concerns about G42's previous ties to China. Discover how this investment reflects Microsoft's continued expansion in the Middle East cloud market, as it competes with rivals to capture the growing demand for cloud services in the region.For more captivating stories and in-depth analysis of the latest developments in technology, science, and beyond, visit Perplexity.ai and download the Perplexity app on Android or iOS.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Limitless AI pendant review
  • The history of microchip graffiti
  • Microsoft drops $1.5b on G42

item.title: Tesla's Shakeup, Humane's AI Pin Debate, and the Rise of a Robotics Billionaire

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

Discover the latest tech news and innovations with Discover Daily, the AI-powered podcast by Perplexity. In today's episode, we dive into Tesla's major workforce shakeup as the electric vehicle giant adapts to changing market conditions. Learn about the implications of these layoffs and executive departures for Tesla's future growth strategies.

We also take a closer look at the Humane AI Pin, a groundbreaking wearable device that promises to seamlessly integrate artificial intelligence into your daily life. Discover the features, potential, and limitations of this innovative gadget as we analyze the mixed reviews from tech experts and users. Is the AI Pin the future of wearable tech, or does it still have a long way to go?

Finally, we introduce you to Brett Adcock, the visionary leader behind Figure AI, a startup that has raised over $750 million to develop transformative humanoid robots. With backing from tech giants like Jeff Bezos, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Amazon, Figure AI is poised to revolutionize industries and shape the future of AI and robotics. Discover how Adcock's ambitious plans could impact the world of work and innovation.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Tesla layoffs and executives departure
  • Humane AI pin reviews
  • New AI robotics billionaire

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, powered by Perplexity, we explore three groundbreaking stories from the world of technology and marketing. First, we delve into the highly anticipated Llama 3 AI model from Meta, which promises advanced capabilities, open-source accessibility, and the potential to rival leading models like GPT-4. With its expected 140 billion parameters and multimodal capabilities, Llama 3 is poised to revolutionize the AI landscape. Stay informed about the latest developments in artificial intelligence by visiting perplexity.ai, your go-to source for cutting-edge AI news and insights.

Next, we discuss Apple's surprising decision to allow video game console emulators on the App Store, a move that has retro gaming enthusiasts rejoicing. This policy change opens up new possibilities for iOS users to enjoy classic games on their devices, while also presenting opportunities for Apple to explore new revenue streams. Finally, we showcase McDonald's innovative scented billboard campaign in the Netherlands, which leverages the power of smell to evoke emotional memories and attract customers. To stay up-to-date with the most fascinating stories from around the web, be sure to subscribe to Discover Daily and download the Perplexity app on Android or iOS. Visit perplexity.ai

  • Apple approves old games emulators
  • McDonalds fries scented campaign

item.itunes:title: Gravity-Defying Materials, Microsoft's Start Menu Surprise, and Lunar Robot Canines
item.title: Gravity-Defying Materials, Microsoft's Start Menu Surprise, and Lunar Robot Canines
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily by Perplexity, we discuss a new material developed by researchers in Japan that enables stable magnetic levitation without requiring an external power source. The centimeter-sized thin square plate, made from graphite coated with silica, hovers above a grid of magnets by harnessing the diamagnetic properties of graphite. This frictionless, self-sustaining floating platform technology could lead to the de...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily by Perplexity, we discuss a new material developed by researchers in Japan that enables stable magnetic levitation without requiring an external power source. The centimeter-sized thin square plate, made from graphite coated with silica, hovers above a grid of magnets by harnessing the diamagnetic properties of graphite. This frictionless, self-sustaining floating platform technology could lead to the development of highly sensitive sensors for measuring force, acceleration, and gravity.

Next, we cover Microsoft's recent testing of built-in advertisements in the Windows 11 Start menu. These ads, targeting users with local accounts, promote the benefits of signing up for a Microsoft account and using Microsoft services. Despite negative user feedback, Microsoft appears to be expanding its advertising efforts within the Windows operating system, including the Settings app.

Finally, we explore the development of robotic "dogs" by various space agencies and research institutions for potential lunar exploration. These four-legged robots, such as the ANYmal-based robot backed by the European Space Agency and NASA's Au-Spot, are designed to navigate challenging terrains on the Moon and Mars that are inaccessible to traditional wheeled rovers. While most of these projects are still in the research and testing phase, robotic dogs could play a significant role in future lunar missions and support human exploration of the Moon.

To learn more about these stories, visit:

item.content:encoded:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily by Perplexity, we discuss a new material developed by researchers in Japan that enables stable magnetic levitation without requiring an external power source. The centimeter-sized thin square plate, made from graphite coated with silica, hovers above a grid of magnets by harnessing the diamagnetic properties of graphite. This frictionless, self-sustaining floating platform technology could lead to the development of highly sensitive sensors for measuring force, acceleration, and gravity.

Next, we cover Microsoft's recent testing of built-in advertisements in the Windows 11 Start menu. These ads, targeting users with local accounts, promote the benefits of signing up for a Microsoft account and using Microsoft services. Despite negative user feedback, Microsoft appears to be expanding its advertising efforts within the Windows operating system, including the Settings app.

Finally, we explore the development of robotic "dogs" by various space agencies and research institutions for potential lunar exploration. These four-legged robots, such as the ANYmal-based robot backed by the European Space Agency and NASA's Au-Spot, are designed to navigate challenging terrains on the Moon and Mars that are inaccessible to traditional wheeled rovers. While most of these projects are still in the research and testing phase, robotic dogs could play a significant role in future lunar missions and support human exploration of the Moon.

To learn more about these stories, visit:

item.title: Firefly's Training Secrets, Falcon 9's 20th Flight, and the Podcast Ad Illusion
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore three stories that showcase the latest developments and controversies in the world of technology and space exploration. First, we examine the ethical concerns surrounding Adobe's AI image generator, Firefly, which has been found to use AI-generated images from competitors in its training data, sparking a debate about transparency and ethics in AI development. We then celebrate SpaceX's groundbreaking achievement in rocket reusability, as they launch a Falcon 9 rocket first stage for a record-breaking 20th time, paving the way for more cost-effective and accessible space travel.

Finally, we shed light on the growing trend of fake video podcast ads, where actors are hired to create scripted content that mimics the authenticity of genuine podcast segments. This deceptive marketing practice raises concerns about consumer deception in the digital age, as it becomes increasingly difficult to distinguish between authentic content and paid advertisements. Join us as we explore these stories and their implications for the future of technology, space exploration, and digital media.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

Adobe trained Firefly on Midjourney

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, powered by Perplexity, we explore three significant stories that demonstrate the impact of technology and innovation. First, we examine TikTok's use of AI-generated digital avatars for content creation and advertising, offering a cost-effective and engaging way for businesses and creators to produce interactive experiences. Despite concerns surrounding privacy and traditional content creation jobs, TikTok continues to push the boundaries of AI innovation on its platform.

Next, we discuss the collaboration between NASA and the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), which will see the first non-American astronaut walk on the Moon as part of the Artemis program. Japan's development of the Lunar Cruiser, a pressurized rover designed for crewed and uncrewed missions, highlights the importance of international cooperation in space exploration. Finally, we uncover Costco's success in the gold market, generating substantial monthly revenue from the sale of 24-karat gold bars amidst economic uncertainty and rising gold prices. For more fascinating stories and in-depth analysis, visit perplexity.ai

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this captivating episode of Discover Daily, powered by Perplexity, we explore three fascinating stories from the world of technology. First, we look into Microsoft's pitch of OpenAI's DALL-E to the U.S. Department of Defense for military applications, raising questions about the ethical implications of AI in warfare. Next, we discuss the potential dropping of charges against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange by the U.S. government, sparking a debate about press freedom and national security. Finally, we examine Meta's development of custom AI processors, such as the Meta Training and Inference Accelerator (MTIA), to enhance their AI capabilities and reduce reliance on third-party hardware. 

Discover Daily, the AI-generated podcast brought to you by Perplexity, is your go-to source for the most intriguing stories in tech, science, and beyond. By curating content from Perplexity's Discover feed, this podcast keeps you informed, entertained, and inspired by the latest developments shaping our world. Subscribe to Discover Daily on your favorite podcast platform and download the Perplexity app on Android or iOS to access even more captivating content. Stay curious and join the conversation with Perplexity's Discover Daily podcast.

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

Discover Daily, the bite-sized podcast from Perplexity, explores the latest developments in technology, science, and culture in its most recent episode. Hosted by Alex, whose voice is powered by ElevenLabs AI, the show takes listeners on a fascinating journey through stories about brain-computer interfaces, groundbreaking discoveries in particle physics, and bold predictions about the future of artificial intelligence.

The episode features Gabe Newell's startup Starfish Neuroscience, which aims to revolutionize gaming experiences by integrating them directly with the human brain. It also covers the monumental contribution of Nobel Prize-winning physicist Peter Higgs and his prediction of the Higgs boson, often referred to as the "God Particle." Finally, the show examines Elon Musk's prediction that AI could surpass human intelligence by 2026, based on rapid advancements in AI technology and the influx of brilliant minds into the field. Discover Daily offers an engaging and informative look at the trends and ideas shaping our future.

  • Valve's founder brain-computer startup
  • Peter Higgs 'God Particle' discovery
  • Musk thinks AI outsmarts us by 2026

item.title: Spotify's AI Playlists, Dubai's Cloud Seeding Drones, and Bacterial Kamikaze for Medicine
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! First, we dive into Spotify's latest AI endeavor: a new feature that allows users to create personalized playlists using prompts. By leveraging the power of artificial intelligence, Spotify aims to revolutionize music discovery and enhance user engagement on its platform. The company's investment in AI e...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore three fascinating stories at the intersection of AI, weather modification, and microbiology. First, we dive into Spotify's latest AI endeavor: a new feature that allows users to create personalized playlists using prompts. By leveraging the power of artificial intelligence, Spotify aims to revolutionize music discovery and enhance user engagement on its platform. The company's investment in AI extends beyond this feature, with plans to use generative AI for podcast summarization, audio ad creation, and assisting artists in the music creation process.

Next, we travel to Dubai, where the United Arab Emirates is combating water scarcity through the use of sophisticated cloud seeding technology. By dispersing substances like potassium chloride and sodium chloride into the air, Dubai is stimulating the formation of artificial rain to address the challenges posed by its arid climate. The UAE Research Program for Rain Enhancement Science plays a crucial role in advancing this technology, with recent developments involving the use of electrical charges from drones to manipulate weather and induce rainfall. Finally, we explore the intriguing world of "kamikaze bacteria," where certain bacteria sacrifice themselves for the benefit of their population by releasing toxins in a self-destructive manner. This discovery not only sheds light on the complex behavior of these microorganisms but also holds promise for the development of new antibiotics and innovative cancer therapies using engineered bacteria.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Spotify launches AI-prompted playlists
  • Dubai artificial rain technology
  • Kamikaze bacteria explode with toxins

item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, host Alex, powered by ElevenLabs AI, explores three fascinating stories at the intersection of science and technology. First, we dive into Shutterstock's game-changing AI training deals with tech giants like OpenAI, Meta, Google, Amazon, and Apple. These partnerships involve licensing Shutterstock's vast library of images, videos, and music to train AI models, positioning the company as a key player in the AI revolution while ensuring artists are fairly compensated.

Next, we turn our attention to the upcoming Great North American Eclipse on April 8, 2024. This rare and spectacular total solar eclipse will be visible across Mexico, the United States, and Canada, with the path of totality stretching from coast to coast. We discuss viewing safety, educational opportunities, and the significance of this celestial event. Finally, we explore the controversial cloud brightening experiment in San Francisco, where researchers are testing marine cloud brightening as a potential tool to combat climate change by spraying sea salt particles into the atmosphere to increase cloud reflectivity and cool the planet.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Shutterstock AI-training deals
  • The Great North American Eclipse
  • San Francisco’s cloud brightening test

This partnership aims to revolutionize the AI hardware landscape, promising to deliver innovative devices that could shape the future of how we interact with artificial intelligence. We discuss the potential implications of this project and the involvement of key figures like Tan Tang and Masayoshi Son.

Next, we turn our attention to SpaceX and its ambitious plans for Mars colonization. We examine the company's progress, challenges, and the central role of the Starship launch vehicle in achieving Elon Musk's vision of establishing a self-sustaining city on the Red Planet. We also touch upon the intriguing methods used by OpenAI to train its most advanced language model, GPT-4, including the use of over a million hours of YouTube video transcriptions. For more in-depth analysis and the latest updates on these fascinating stories, visit perplexity.ai, your go-to source for AI, tech, and science news.

From Perplexity's Discover feed:

  • Jony Ive and Sam Altman AI device
  • SpaceX Mars plans update
  • GPT-4 trained on YouTube transcripts

We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily by Perplexity, we dive into Tesla's upcoming robotaxi unveiling, set for August 8th, and explore what this autonomous vehicle could mean for the future of transportation. We also discuss Alphabet's potential acquisition of HubSpot, a blockbuster deal that could reshape the marketing software landscape - if it can overcome antitrust hurdles. Finally, we take a look at Apple's surprising pivot to home robotics after shuttering its electric car project. From mobile robots that follow you around to tabletop devices with moving displays, we break down Apple's ambitious plans to find its next big thing.

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, presented by Perplexity, we explore three remarkable stories that showcase the dynamic landscape of technology, law, and space exploration. First, we delve into the U.S. government's significant $2 billion Bitcoin transfer to Coinbase, connected to the seizure of 50,000 Bitcoin from the notorious Silk Road website. This transfer highlights the intricate relationship between traditional financial institutions, government authorities, and the decentralized nature of cryptocurrencies, while also discussing the potential risks associated with government control over digital currencies, as cautioned by U.S. presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

Next, we examine the landmark lawsuit involving the estate of the late comedian George Carlin and the creators of an AI-generated comedy special featuring a clone of Carlin. This case emphasizes the growing concerns surrounding the use of artificial intelligence to impersonate individuals without consent and the potential for future litigation regarding AI-generated content and copyright law. Finally, we explore NASA's pioneering initiative to establish Coordinated Lunar Time (LTC), a unified standard of time on the moon. As the number of lunar missions continues to rise, the need for a common time reference becomes paramount to ensure precise coordination and communication among future lunar expeditions. For more captivating stories like these, be sure to download the Perplexity app on Android or iOS and visit our website to stay up-to-date with the latest curated content.

For more from Perplexity's Discover Feed:

Feds transfer $2b of seized bitcoin

George Carlin's AI clone lawsuit

item.itunes:title: Google's AI Search Paywall, Matrix Reboot, and Artists vs. AI
item.title: Google's AI Search Paywall, Matrix Reboot, and Artists vs. AI
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this captivating episode of Discover Daily, host Alex, powered by ElevenLabs, delves into three compelling stories curated from Perplexity's Discover feed. First, we explore Google's potential implementation of a paywall for premium artificial intelligence (AI) search features, marking a significant shift in the tech giant's business model. This move reflects Google's efforts to monetize its advanced AI technologies while supporting digi...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this captivating episode of Discover Daily, host Alex, powered by ElevenLabs, delves into three compelling stories curated from Perplexity's Discover feed. First, we explore Google's potential implementation of a paywall for premium artificial intelligence (AI) search features, marking a significant shift in the tech giant's business model. This move reflects Google's efforts to monetize its advanced AI technologies while supporting digital publishers in determining which content to place behind paywalls. Next, we discuss the exciting announcement of a fifth installment in the Matrix franchise, with a new creative team led by Drew Goddard. As plot details remain under wraps, fans speculate about the future of this iconic series and the potential return of stars like Keanu Reeves and Carrie-Anne Moss.

Finally, we examine the music industry's response to the unethical use of AI in music production, as over 200 artists, including Billie Eilish and Pearl Jam, sign an open letter condemning practices that replace human artistry and dilute royalty pools. The letter, organized by the Artist Rights Alliance, urges tech companies and AI developers to pledge not to deploy AI music-generation technology that undermines human creativity and denies fair compensation. This movement highlights the complex copyright and ethical issues surrounding AI in the creative process and the need for responsible AI use to protect the livelihoods of working musicians, artists, and songwriters in the streaming era.

More from Perplexity's Discover Feed:

  • Google Considers Paywall for AI Search
  • The Matrix Franchise Reboots with Fifth Movie
  • Artists Unite Against AI in Music

item.itunes:title: Yahoo Acquires Artifact, Amazon's Dashcart Dilemma, and the Impending AI Data Drought
item.title: Yahoo Acquires Artifact, Amazon's Dashcart Dilemma, and the Impending AI Data Drought
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three significant developments in the world of AI and tech. First, we discuss Yahoo's acquisition of Artifact, an AI-driven news startup, and how this move could revolutionize personalized content delivery across Yahoo's platforms. We also examine Amazon's surprising decision to end its "Just Walk Out" cashierless technology in grocery stores, replacing it with "Dash Carts" that require item ...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three significant developments in the world of AI and tech. First, we discuss Yahoo's acquisition of Artifact, an AI-driven news startup, and how this move could revolutionize personalized content delivery across Yahoo's platforms. We also examine Amazon's surprising decision to end its "Just Walk Out" cashierless technology in grocery stores, replacing it with "Dash Carts" that require item scanning, reflecting a broader industry trend of finding the right balance between automation and human interaction in retail.

Finally, we delve into the potential "data drought" that experts predict could hit the AI industry as soon as 2026. As AI models consume high-quality training data at an unprecedented rate, the shortage of diverse and ethically-sourced datasets could slow the pace of AI progress. We explore the implications of this challenge and the innovative solutions being developed to address it, from algorithmic improvements to synthetic data generation and data sharing initiatives. Join us as we unpack these fascinating stories and their impact on the future of AI and tech.

For more on these stories:

Yahoo acquires Artifact
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Yahoo-acquires-Artifact-A7BQHWVNQk.ahmBdI0vX1w

Amazon ends AI-checkout stores
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Amazon-ends-AIcheckout-IpciSQbPQu6AbAYBFzhVpQ

2026 AI data drought
https://www.perplexity.ai/search/2026-AI-data-p5WHafatSneygKa9b6NncA

item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode of Discover Daily, we celebrate Apple's incredible 48-year journey, from its humble beginnings in Steve Jobs' parents' garage to becoming one of the world's most valuable and influential technology companies. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we celebrate Apple's incredible 48-year journey, from its humble beginnings in Steve Jobs' parents' garage to becoming one of the world's most valuable and influential technology companies. We explore the iconic products that have redefined entire markets, such as the Apple II, Macintosh, iPod, iPhone, and iPad, and discuss how Apple's commitment to innovation, design, and user experience has set the standard for the tech industry.

We also look into the latest developments in the world of technology, including OpenAI's startup fund shakeup, as CEO Sam Altman transfers control to Ian Hathaway, and the upcoming EU version of the AltStore, which takes advantage of new rules introduced by the Digital Markets Act (DMA) to provide iOS users with more choice and flexibility in accessing apps. Join us as we uncover these stories and more, curated from Perplexity's daily updated Discover feed.

For more on these stories:

48 years of Apple

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!


Discover the latest developments in AI regulation, celebrate a cinematic milestone, and uncover surprising archaeological findings in this captivating episode of Discover Daily. Join host Alex as he delves into the US House's ban on Microsoft's AI chatbot, Copilot, and explores the implications of this decision for the rapidly evolving AI sector.

 Travel back in time to commemorate the 25th anniversary of the groundbreaking film "The Matrix," and learn how its innovative visual effects, thought-provoking themes, and enduring legacy continue to inspire and captivate audiences worldwide.Unearth the shocking discovery of microplastics in ancient soil samples, challenging our understanding of the past and the pervasiveness of plastic pollution. Explore the potential consequences for the field of archaeology and the urgent need for further research. 

Finally, witness the iconic Lamborghini brand's transformation as it unveils a redesigned logo and embarks on a journey towards an electrified future.

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore the cutting-edge advancements in AI voice cloning technology, focusing on OpenAI's new "Voice Engine" model. Learn about the potential applications, ethical concerns, and the industry's approach to responsible deployment of this powerful technology. We also delve into the National WWII Museum's innovative use of AI in their "Voices From the Front" exhibit, which allows visitors to interact with virtual veterans and preserve their stories for future generations.

Explore the Philosophical Debate Surrounding AI and UnderstandingIn the second half of the episode, we introduce the famous Chinese Room thought experiment proposed by philosopher John Searle. This thought-provoking argument challenges the notion of "strong AI" and questions whether computers can truly understand and have genuine mental states. Join us as we examine the implications of this thought experiment on the nature of intelligence and the future of AI development. Discover Daily brings you a fascinating blend of cutting-edge technology and philosophical discourse, all in one engaging podcast.

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

Discover the latest breakthroughs and controversies in artificial intelligence with today's episode of Discover Daily. Join us as we explore Microsoft and OpenAI's $100 billion "Stargate" supercomputer project, set to revolutionize AI development with millions of specialized AI chips. Learn about the challenges and implications of this ambitious collaboration.

We also delve into the heated debate surrounding the BBC's decision to replace actress Sara Poyzer with an AI-generated voice in an upcoming documentary. Discover how this incident has sparked discussions about the role of AI in the creative industries and its potential impact on actors and voice artists. Stay informed about the ongoing debate in the entertainment industry regarding AI use and the need for clear guidelines and protections for creative professionals.

Finally, we examine New York City's plan to test AI-based gun detection systems in its subways to enhance public safety. Understand the technology behind these scanners, the controversies surrounding their accuracy and privacy implications, and the broader debate over the use of AI in surveillance and security.Don't miss out on this informative and thought-provoking episode of Discover Daily, your go-to source for the most captivating stories and developments in artificial intelligence. Subscribe now on your favorite podcast platform and download the Perplexity app on Android or iOS to stay up-to-date with the latest AI news, insights, and analysis. Join the conversation and explore the future of AI with Perplexity.

item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode of Discover Daily, we dive into X's (formerly Twitter) new feature that allows users to create and join communities focused on adult content or NSFW material. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we dive into X's (formerly Twitter) new feature that allows users to create and join communities focused on adult content or NSFW material. This development is part of X's strategy to differentiate itself from other social media platforms by openly offering NSFW groups while protecting underage users and those who wish to avoid explicit content. We also explore the Netherlands' groundbreaking hyperloop test track, which marks a significant milestone in the development of this futuristic transportation technology. The European Hyperloop Center in Groningen features a unique "lane switch" feature, paving the way for further research and development.

Additionally, we discuss Meta's upcoming enhancement to its Ray-Ban smart glasses, which will integrate artificial intelligence capabilities. Users will be able to activate the glasses' smart assistant by saying "Hey Meta" and asking questions about their surroundings. The New York Times tested the glasses in various settings, revealing the AI's strengths and limitations in identifying objects, animals, and monuments. Meta's pivot towards AI represents a significant shift for the company as it continues to integrate innovative technology into its products.

item.itunes:title: Amazon Invests $4B in AI's Anthropic, Truth Social's Inflated Valuation, and Climate Change Affects Earth's Rotation
item.title: Amazon Invests $4B in AI's Anthropic, Truth Social's Inflated Valuation, and Climate Change Affects Earth's Rotation
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three fascinating stories from the worlds of tech, business, and science: Amazon's $4 Billion AI Bet: We discuss Amazon's massive investment in AI startup Anthropic, the makers of the impressive Claude chatbot. This move underscores the intense competition among tech giants to gain an edge in the rapidly evolving field of generative AI. Truth Social's Inflated Valuation: We examine the infla...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three fascinating stories from the worlds of tech, business, and science:

  1. Amazon's $4 Billion AI Bet: We discuss Amazon's massive investment in AI startup Anthropic, the makers of the impressive Claude chatbot. This move underscores the intense competition among tech giants to gain an edge in the rapidly evolving field of generative AI.

  2. Truth Social's Inflated Valuation: We examine the inflated market valuation of Truth Social, which soared to around $11 billion on its first day of trading despite the company's modest revenue and user base. Many experts believe this high valuation is driven by investor enthusiasm rather than fundamentals, drawing comparisons to the "meme stock" phenomenon.

  3. Climate Change Slows Earth's Rotation: We delve into the surprising impact of global warming on Earth's rotation. Research shows that melting polar ice due to climate change is redistributing mass towards the equator, slowing down the planet's spin. This has implications for global timekeeping, potentially delaying the need for a negative leap second and causing headaches for computer systems. It's a powerful reminder of the far-reaching effects of human-caused climate change on our planet.

Links:

  • Amazon invests $2.75 billion more in AI startup Anthropic (Link)
  • Trump's Truth Social Rockets Over 65% as Trading Begins (Link)
  • Melting ice is slowing down Earth's rotation, study finds (Link)

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we dive into three compelling stories from the world of tech and business. First, we explore the anticipation surrounding Apple's WWDC 2024, where the company is expected to showcase its latest artificial intelligence (AI) innovations across its software ecosystem, including iOS, macOS, and more. We also discuss the potential for exciting hardware announcements, such as the rumored M3 Ultra chip, which could bring significant performance boosts to high-end Macs.

Next, we turn our attention to the shocking news of WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann's bid to buy back the bankrupt company he once led. We analyze the implications of this unexpected move and the reactions it has generated in the business community. Finally, we cover the significant leadership changes at Microsoft, as the head of Bing and the company's advertising division, Mikhail Parakhin, steps down amidst a broader corporate restructuring focused on prioritizing AI development. Join us as we unravel these fascinating stories and provide expert insights in today's episode of Discover Daily, your go-to podcast for the latest in technology and business news.

item.itunes:title: Trump's Truth Social goes public, Boeing CEO resigns, and a 30-year-old Windows feature
item.title: Trump's Truth Social goes public, Boeing CEO resigns, and a 30-year-old Windows feature
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three captivating stories from the worlds of business, technology, and software development. First, we delve into former President Donald Trump's return to the stock market as his social media company, Truth Social, goes public through a merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp (DWAC). With a 58.1% stake, Trump stands to potentially earn over $3-4 billion, but faces a 6-month lock-up period...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three captivating stories from the worlds of business, technology, and software development. First, we delve into former President Donald Trump's return to the stock market as his social media company, Truth Social, goes public through a merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp (DWAC). With a 58.1% stake, Trump stands to potentially earn over $3-4 billion, but faces a 6-month lock-up period before he can sell shares. We examine the details of the deal, Truth Social's $5B+ valuation, and the investigations that delayed the merger.

Next, we discuss the major leadership shakeup at Boeing as the aerospace giant grapples with ongoing safety issues and a federal investigation. CEO Dave Calhoun announces his resignation amid the fallout from the 737 MAX door blowout incident, while Boeing Commercial Airplanes CEO Stan Deal retires immediately and other top executives shift roles. We analyze the challenges Boeing faces in restoring its reputation and addressing deep-rooted cultural problems following the two deadly 737 MAX crashes in 2018-19 and other safety problems.

Finally, we uncover the surprising 30-year history of a "temporary" menu feature in Microsoft Windows, created by engineer Raymond Chen in 1994, which has persisted through every version of the operating system up to Windows 11. This anecdote highlights the unexpected longevity of some software components and the challenges of replacing familiar elements, even if they were originally intended as quick fixes, reflecting the complex, layered history of software development at Microsoft and across the tech industry.

Trump's Truth Social goes public

https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Trumps-Truth-Social-qHHTDaBnQAebdoUoR9iNlw

Boeing CEO resigns

https://www.perplexity.ai/search/Boeing-CEO-resigns-BrhYJWVnTEyEOdO67y2KvQ

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode we dive into Apple's highly anticipated iOS 18 update is rumored to incorporate a variety of new AI features, potentially through partnerships with leading AI companies like Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google. Anthropic's recently unveiled Claude 3 AI models, particularly the powerful Claude 3 Opus, have garnered attention for outperforming rivals like GPT-4 and Google's Gemini 1.0 Ultra in various benchmarks. This positions Anthropic as a strong contender for collaboration with Apple on integrating advanced AI capabilities into iOS 18.

The potential inclusion of Anthropic's technology could enable Apple to leverage Claude 3's multimodal AI prowess, allowing for seamless interactions with both text and images across various iOS applications. This aligns with Apple's broader strategy to enhance the iOS ecosystem with generative AI features spanning Siri, Spotlight, Apple Music, Messages, and more. While details remain speculative, a potential Apple-Anthropic partnership highlights Apple's commitment to advancing its AI capabilities and redefining user experiences through cutting-edge technology.

For more on these stories:

item.title: Stability AI's Leadership Shakeup, Financial Times' AI Bot, and the Pre-Launch Buzz of Rabbit R1

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore major developments in the world of AI. We start with the resignation of Emad Mostaque, founder and CEO of Stability AI, amid challenges including investor disputes, staff departures, and controversies around his leadership. Mostaque, who grew Stability AI to a billion-dollar valuation, expressed his belief in the company's mission and the importance of decentralizing power in AI.

Next, we discuss the launch of "Ask FT," a new AI chatbot by the Financial Times that provides curated answers to subscriber questions using the newspaper's own article archives. We also cover the highly anticipated release of the Rabbit R1, a consumer AI device set to start shipping to the first US buyers on Easter Sunday, March 31st, with a pickup party planned in New York City on April 23rd.


Stability AI CEO resigns

item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore the intersection of technology and society across three distinct segments. We begin by discussing the successful test flight of Boom Supersonic's XB-1 demonstrator aircraft, which marks a significant step towards the reintroduction of supersonic passenger travel. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In this episode of Discover Daily, we explore the intersection of technology and society across three distinct segments. We begin by discussing the successful test flight of Boom Supersonic's XB-1 demonstrator aircraft, which marks a significant step towards the reintroduction of supersonic passenger travel. 

Next, we shift our focus to Japan, where the government is utilizing AI-powered matchmaking services to address the country's declining birth rates and aging population, sparking a conversation about the role of technology in tackling complex social issues. 

Finally, we take a look at the upcoming opening of the Hollywood Sci-Fi Science Fiction Museum in California, which aims to celebrate the genre's history while educating visitors about real-world science. Through these diverse stories, the episode highlights the far-reaching impact of technological advancements on various aspects of our lives.

Boom Supersonic test flight

item.itunes:title: United States sues Apple, Reddit IPO first day pop, Android 15 satellite messaging
item.title: United States sues Apple, Reddit IPO first day pop, Android 15 satellite messaging
item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three significant developments in the tech world. First, we delve into the major antitrust lawsuit filed by the U.S. Department of Justice and several states against Apple, accusing the company of maintaining an illegal monopoly in the smartphone market. The lawsuit targets Apple's control over iOS app distribution, its App Store commissions, and practices that allegedly hinder rival technolo...
item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore three significant developments in the tech world. First, we delve into the major antitrust lawsuit filed by the U.S. Department of Justice and several states against Apple, accusing the company of maintaining an illegal monopoly in the smartphone market. The lawsuit targets Apple's control over iOS app distribution, its App Store commissions, and practices that allegedly hinder rival technologies. Apple has vowed to vigorously defend itself, setting the stage for a legal battle with far-reaching implications for the tech industry.

Next, we discuss Reddit's successful IPO, which saw the company's shares soar 48% on their first day of trading, valuing the online discussion platform at $9.5 billion. Despite concerns about profitability, Reddit raised $519 million and even reserved a portion of IPO shares for its moderators and power users. Finally, we look at the upcoming Android 15 update, which is set to introduce satellite messaging capabilities in partnership with T-Mobile and SpaceX. This feature will allow users to send and receive text messages via satellite, extending connectivity to areas without cellular coverage and representing a significant step forward in mobile communication.

For more on these stories:

  • United States sues Apple
  • Reddit IPO first day pop
  • Android 15 satellite messaging

We delved into the rumors and speculation surrounding the highly anticipated release of GPT-5 from OpenAI, discussed the potential impact of Saudi Arabia's proposed $40 billion AI fund in partnership with Andreessen Horowitz, and marveled at the groundbreaking demonstration of Neuralink's brain-computer interface technology, which allowed a quadriplegic patient to play online chess and video games using only his mind. These stories highlight the rapid advancements and endless possibilities in the realm of artificial intelligence and neurotechnology, promising a future filled with innovation and life-changing developments.

item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

First up, we'll dive into Microsoft's latest strategic move in the generative AI space, as the tech giant hires Mustafa Suleyman, co-founder of Google's DeepMind, to lead its consumer artificial intelligence division. We'll explore what this means for Microsoft's AI ambitions and the competitive landscape.
 
Next, we'll take a look at Nvidia's groundbreaking initiative, Project GR00T, which aims to revolutionize the field of humanoid robotics. We'll discuss how this project could pave the way for more advanced and interactive robots in our daily lives.

Finally, we'll take a nostalgic trip down memory lane as we explore Facebook's surprising revival of one of its most iconic features: the Poke. We'll examine why the social media giant is bringing back this blast from the past and what it means for user engagement.

For more on these stories:

  • Inflection founders join Microsoft
  • Nvidia powers humanoid robots
  • Facebook brings back Poke

item.itunes:summary: We're experimenting and would love to hear from you! In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore four captivating stories that showcase the rapid advancements and growing influence of artificial intelligence across various industries. item.description:
We're experimenting and would love to hear from you!

In today's episode of Discover Daily, we explore four captivating stories that showcase the rapid advancements and growing influence of artificial intelligence across various industries. 

We begin with Nvidia's groundbreaking Blackwell B200 AI chip, which promises to revolutionize AI computing capabilities and cement Nvidia's position at the center of the AI revolution. 

Next, we discuss the potential collaboration between Apple and Google on integrating Google's Gemini AI models into iOS 18, which could significantly enhance the iPhone's AI capabilities while raising concerns about data privacy and antitrust issues.
 
We then examine YouTube's new policy requiring creators to label AI-generated content, addressing the ethical challenges posed by AI in content creation and ensuring transparency for viewers. 

Finally, we highlight Pfizer's pioneering use of generative AI in the pharmaceutical industry with their advanced platform Charlie, setting a benchmark for ethical AI deployment in healthcare and potentially transforming the pharmaceutical landscape.

For more on these stories:

  • Nvidia unveils Blackwell
  • Gemini-powered iPhone features
  • YouTube labels AI-made videos
  • Pfizer's Charlie AI
